etymology.description: 禾(禾) (hé, 'cereal') + 口(口) (kǒu, 'bag or rope') + 刀(刀) (dāo, 'knife, blade') -> to cut cereal plants, to harvest -> stylized to 柬(柬) (jiǎn, 'bag stuffed with herbs') + 刀(刀) (dāo, 'knife, blade')
etymology.interpretation: The character 剌 was originally about harvesting cereal plants, symbolized by a knife cutting the plants. Its form evolved on bronze inscriptions, integrating elements symbolizing a bag stuffed with herbs and a knife, reflecting the harvesting process.

examples.chinese: 他的服装风格剌(剌)，十分与众不同(與眾不同)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de fúzhuāng fēnggé là, shífèn yǔzhòng bùtóng.
examples.english: His fashion style is distinct, very unique.

examples.chinese: 那幅画的颜色运用剌(剌)，显得格外醒目(格外醒目)。
examples.pinyin: Nà fú huà de yánsè yùnyòng là, xiǎnde géwài xǐngmù.
examples.english: The use of colors in that painting is distinct, making it particularly eye-catching.
